instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> BIOS Needed
threads.message: Hi all, I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in with it's BIOS chip wiped off the map. Got a new one from a donor board and I've tried downloading the files with clean ME available on the forum and editing the SN/fixing checksum, and while I followed through Piernov's videos and managed to flash/verify with my CH341 I'm almost certain I mucked something up - I soldered the chip onto the board to test without doing anything to it and it booted half way through the loading bar, but now the board is only power cycling and doesn't turn on. Would someone be able to generate a BIOS for SN C1MQ4K9ZG940 so I can rule out my own mistakes in editing the BIOS file? Thanks so much!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> BIOS Needed
threads.message:
You can test flashing the downloaded file as is; don't change anything on it.
If board works, then you can consider to modify the BIOS according to your necesity.
